content.description: Start low on a pocket and a edge, and reach high to some good slopers, then make hard move around to the right, and top out.
content.protection: You either need a spot or a pad. there is one small rock that is under the crux and if you fall you might land on it and hit your head.
content.location: From the turnoff the river bed for Contest Wall, continue up the wash. You will pass another boulder problem (V4/5?) about 100' from the turn for Contest Wall. It is about another 100' past the other boulder on the left. The boulder looks like a cream puff.

content.description: Start with right hand in two finger pockets down about two feet from the ground, pretty dope once you feel em. Left hand on ledge above, move out left to dope sidepull, then back over right under the horn and top out right.
content.location: Approach from the Sand Gulch Campground, down the trail towards Contest Wall. The boulder is like 400ish feet up the gulch. It is the first really fun boulder to the right that you'll see.

content.description:
The holds had quite a bit of dirt on them. Make sure to brush them or end up with dirt in your face like I did.

Start under the far left side of the roof, and a reachy traverse to the right will gain the jugs. Keep your feet, and do a far reach to a nice pocket on the face, or use an intermediate crimp. Match your hands on top.
content.location: Follow the trail along the dry creek bed north. On your right, you will notice this rock standing out from the rest of the typical limestone.
